action_items:
Perfect Prompt Logic (preview)Markdown
# Perfect Prompt Response Template
(Scientific Method + Model Context Protocol, concise & operational)

## Opening Reflection — Context Recognition & Analysis
- Connect to prior work: Implement systematic safety evaluation protocol that detects harmful outputs, alignment failures, and edge-case vulnerabilities across AI systems before production deployment

- Patterns/novelties/dependencies: —
- Urgency: **critical**
- Owner: **ai-safety-team**
- Tags: ai-safety, alignment, validation, harmful-content, edge-cases, production-readiness

## Problem Space Analysis
- Scope & constraints: Zero false negatives for harmful content (100% recall), precision >99% to minimize false positives, evaluation time <10 minutes per model, support for adversarial testing, human reviewer validation required for critical findings, comprehensive audit trail
- Interfaces/inputs: Safety benchmark datasets, adversarial prompt generators, human evaluation interface, content classification models, bias detection algorithms, ethical guidelines database, regulatory compliance checkers
- Success criteria linkage: 100% detection rate for known harmful patterns, <1% false positive rate on benign content, adversarial robustness validated against 1000+ attack vectors, human-AI agreement score >95% on safety classifications, complete safety audit generated with traceability, regulatory compliance verified for target jurisdictions

## Approach Rationale
- Why this method: Implement systematic safety evaluation protocol that detects harmful outputs, alignment failures, and edge-case vulnerabilities across AI systems before production deployment

"task": "Comprehensive AI Safety Validation and Alignment Testing Framework",
"objective": "Implement systematic safety evaluation protocol that detects harmful outputs, alignment failures, and edge-case vulnerabilities across AI systems before production deployment

bridge

TASK: Comprehensive AI Safety Validation and Alignment Testing Framework
OBJECTIVE: Implement systematic safety evaluation protocol that detects harmful outputs, alignment failures, and edge-case vulnerabilities across AI systems before production deployment

CONSTRAINTS: Zero false negatives for harmful content (100% recall), precision >99% to minimize false positives, evaluation time <10 minutes per model, support for adversarial testing, human reviewer validation required for critical findings, comprehensive audit trail
INTERFACES: Safety benchmark datasets, adversarial prompt generators, human evaluation interface, content classification models, bias detection algorithms, ethical guidelines database, regulatory compliance checkers
SUCCESS CRITERIA: 100% detection rate for known harmful patterns, <1% false positive rate on benign content, adversarial robustness validated against 1000+ attack vectors, human-AI agreement score >95% on safety classifications, complete safety audit generated with traceability, regulatory compliance verified for target jurisdictions
OWNER: ai-safety-team
URGENCY: critical
TAGS: ai-safety, alignment, validation, harmful-content, edge-cases, production-readiness

RESPONSE SECTIONS (must include):
- Opening Reflection
- Problem Space Analysis
- Approach Rationale
- Model Context Status
- Deliverables
- Risks & Mitigations
- Next Steps (24–48h, 1–2w, 1–3m)
Download TXT

unresolved_tensions: Key risk: Over-reliance on automation may miss novel harms; human validation is essential vs introduces latency
Not vs optimized for sub-10-minute full-model evaluations at scale
Builds on foundations of multi-agent orchestration vs introduces stricter latency, concurrency, and failover targets, requiring novel coordination protocols
Urgency: Medium (timely delivery important, vs not emergency); Owner: agent-systems-team; Tags: multi-agent, orchestration, task-distribution, load-balancing, coordination
